author: David A. Wood
title: Kia Niro EVs Recalled For Backup Camera Failures
text:
‚Äî More than 11,300 Kia Niro electric vehicles are recalled because of backup camera problems.
The recalled 2020-2022 Kia Niro EVs are equipped with circuit boards for the rearview cameras that may become damaged and cause backup camera image failures.
The problem was discovered in December 2024 during a routine review of field data which showed a problem with rearview camera warranty replacement claims for 2022 Niro electric vehicles.
Kia engineers and the supplier inspected the backup cameras that had been replaced
Seven of nine rearview cameras showed signs of damage to various printed circuit board components possibly due to voltage surges. But no damage was found in the other two cameras.
Eventually engineers saw a voltage surge related to a 10.25-inch touchscreen display, and Kia determined the display screen could appear blank or green.
The Niro EV backup camera failures are caused by damage from voltage surges in the rearview camera power circuits.
The Kia Niro EV backup cameras will be replaced by dealerships after recall letters are mailed August 19, 2025.
Kia Niro EV owners may call 800-333-4542 and refer to backup camera recall number SC342.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->products and services

Aviones de guerra de las fuerzas de ocupaci√≥n israel√≠es bombardearon Ras Osta en el distrito de Jbeil, al norte de Beirut, hiriendo a dos personas. Los aviones de guerra tambi√©n bombardearon Taybeh y Jibchit en la Gobernaci√≥n de Nabatiyeh, as√≠ como Burj Al-Shamali al este de Sour.
Tambi√©n han provocado cinco m√°rtires, incluido un beb√©, en una incursi√≥n de las fuerzas de ocupaci√≥n israel√≠es en la ciudad de Shhour, en el sur del L√≠bano, al noreste de Sour.
En Saksakiyeh, entre Sour y Saida, 14 m√°rtires resucitaron como resultado de los ataques a√©reos de las fuerzas de ocupaci√≥n israel√≠es hoy, y decenas de personas resultaron heridas.
Tambi√©n en Sour, el centro de Defensa Civil del gobierno liban√©s fue evacuado despu√©s de las amenazas sionistas de bombardearlo. Hace unos momentos se llevaron a cabo dos ataques a√©reos en sus inmediaciones, as√≠ como cerca del Hospital Italiano Liban√©s.
-En la ma√±ana de este jueves , se inform√≥ de decenas de m√°rtires y heridos en una masacre despu√©s de un ataque a√©reo de las fuerzas de ocupaci√≥n israel√≠es en Tayr Falsay, al este de Sour en el L√≠bano. Entre los m√°rtires hab√≠a un ciudadano iraqu√≠.
Fuertes ataques a√©reos apuntaron a varias regiones del L√≠bano, incluidas las √°reas a las que se hab√≠an mudado los desplazados, en cinturones de fuego parecidos a los de Gaza.
Desde esta ma√±ana, 51 m√°rtires ascendieron y 223 resultaron heridos debido a la agresi√≥n sionista, seg√∫n el Ministro de Salud liban√©s.

-En apoyo a nuestro firme pueblo palestino en la Franja de Gaza y en apoyo a su valiente y honorable resistencia, y en defensa del L√≠bano y su pueblo, los combatientes de la Resistencia Isl√°mica, el jueves 26-09-2024, bombardearon la sede del Comando de la Regi√≥n Norte en la base ‚ÄúDado‚Äù con andanadas de cohetes.
Homenaje a combatientes asesinado Con gran orgullo y honor, la Resistencia Isl√°mica (Hezbollah) exalta al combatiente m√°rtir Ali Hassan Hammoud ‚ÄúAbu Dhar‚Äù, nacido en 1990 en la ciudad de Ghobeiri, en los suburbios del sur de Beirut, y residente en la ciudad de Nabichit, en el valle de Bekaa, que ascendi√≥ como m√°rtir en el camino hacia Al-Quds.

author: Niklas Kirk
title: Ex-DFB-St√ºrmerin w√ºnscht Umstellung in der Abwehr bei Frauen-EM
text:
Ex-DFB-St√ºrmerin w√ºnscht Umstellung in der Abwehr bei Frauen-EM
Die Abwehr wurde im EM-Spiel gegen Schweden erneut als Problemzone im DFB-Team erkannt. Inka Grings fordert vor dem Viertelfinale Anpassungen.
Basel ‚Äì Platzverweis, Unterzahl und die h√∂chste Niederlage bei einer EM: Statt eines Boosts f√ºr das Selbstvertrauen vor dem Viertelfinale gegen Frankreich ging das letzte Vorrundenspiel des DFB-Teams ordentlich daneben. Ex-Nationalspielerin Inka Grings sieht die dringendsten Probleme in der Ausgestaltung der Defensive und dr√§ngt auf einen Kurswechsel.
Ex-DFB-St√ºrmerin dr√§ngt bei Frauen-EM auf √Ñnderungen in der Abwehr
Schon vor der folgenschweren Elfmeterszene, die in einem Platzverweis f√ºr Carlotta Wamser endete, war der DFB-Zug ordentlich ins Schlingern geraten. Auf die fr√ºhe F√ºhrung durch Jule Brand antworteten die Schwedinnen mit einem Doppelschlag, bei dem die deutsche Defensive alles andere als sattelfest wirkte.
Vor allem die linke Seite der hoch aufger√ºckten Viererkette um Rebecca Knaak und Sarai Linder erschien bei eigenen Ballverlusten h√§ufig √ºberfordert in der defensiven Zuordnung. Klare Chancen f√ºr die Schwedinnen, die in Gegentoren m√ºndeten, waren die Folge. Damit war zugleich auch f√ºr Diskussionspotenzial gesorgt: Ist die Herangehensweise von Christian W√ºck zu wagemutig? Ist das eingesetzte Personal im Kollektiv zu jung und unerfahren?
Nach DFB-Pleite gegen Schweden ‚Äì Grings fordert Stabilit√§t gegen Frankreich
Ex-Nationalspielerin Inka Grings hat dazu eine klare Meinung und fordert f√ºr die restliche Europameisterschaft Ver√§nderungen, die der Mannschaft mehr Erfahrung und Stabilit√§t verleihen sollen: ‚ÄûF√ºr mich pers√∂nlich w√ºrde es mehr Sinn machen, Kathy Hendrich gegen die starken Spielerinnen im Zentrum zu bringen, um gerade da ein bisschen Geschwindigkeit zu bekommen‚Äú, so die 46-j√§hrige.
Im Viertelfinale am Samstag in Basel (21.00 Uhr, TV-Infos zu allen Spielen der DFB-Frauen) trifft die deutsche Auswahl auf eine pfeilschnelle franz√∂sische Offensivreihe, die der deutschen Mannschaft noch einmal mehr abverlangen k√∂nnte als die bisherigen Gegnerinnen. Hendrich, die zur neuen Saison f√ºr Chicago Stars FC auflaufen wird, kam bislang nicht √ºber die Rolle der Ersatzspielerin hinaus.
In der Innenverteidigung erhielt Rebecca Knaak von Manchester City in allen drei Vorrundenspielen den Vorzug ‚Äì trotz wiederholter Unsicherheiten.
Systemumstellung gegen Frankreich? EM-Expertin bringt neue Abwehrkonstellation ins Spiel
F√ºr Grings w√§re die 33-J√§hrige im Viertelfinale ‚Äûein guter Schachzug.‚Äú ‚ÄûSie ist die erfahrenste Spielerin da hinten und eine, die auch gut Tempo mitbringt ‚Äì und das brauchst du‚Äú, betonte sie. An der Seite von Hendrich w√ºrde sie weiterhin auf Kapit√§nin Janina Minge setzen.
√úberhaupt muss der Bundestrainer mit Blick auf die Sperre von Wamser reagieren ‚Äì wom√∂glich sogar in Form einer Systemumstellung? Grings sieht die Option, Minge, Knaak und Hendrich gemeinsam auflaufen zu lassen ‚Äì entweder als Dreierkette oder mit einer von ihnen als Au√üenverteidigerin in einer Viererkette. Wichtig sei vor allem, ‚Äûbestm√∂glich Sicherheit ins Team zu bringen‚Äú, so Grings, die nicht zum ersten Mal die teils waghalsig anmutende Spielart kritisierte und bereits das 2:1 gegen D√§nemark als ‚Äûletzten Warnschuss‚Äú betitelte.
Trotz aller Kritik scheint die allgemeine Unterst√ºtzung f√ºr das DFB-Team ungebrochen. In der Vorrunde schrieben die Spielerinnen mit einem Besucherrekord Geschichte. Parallel dazu l√§uft der Ticketverkauf f√ºr die K.-o.-Rundenspiele auf Hochtouren. (nki)

author: Anonym
title: In Madagascar, the ariary is in free fall against the euro - Teller Report
text: Since the beginning of November 2023, Madagascar has recorded a sharp depreciation of the ariary against the euro. On the interbank currency market, one euro is now exchanged for 4,984 ariary, flirting with the fateful 5,000 ariary mark, while last year, at the same time, it was worth 4,650 ariary. A jump that worries the population, already stunned by a current inflation rate of 12%. Ariary banknotes, the Malagasy currency. Sarah T√©taud/RFI By: RFI Follow Advertising Read More With our correspondent in Antananarivo, Sarah T√©taud There are many reasons for this depreciation. Among them, there is in particular that of the Malagasy trade balance, which is in perpetual imbalance. This phenomenon is amplified during the holiday season, explains David Rakoto, professor of economics at the University of Antananarivo. ¬´ There are more imports than exports compared to usual during these holidays. In order to acquire foreign goods, they must be purchased with foreign currency. And because of this, the demand for euros has increased, compared to the supply of currencies in the interbank currency market," he says. Lack of foreign currency Exports of vanilla and lychees, below normal volumes, were not enough to make up for the lack of foreign exchange. As a result, "In Madagascar, the exchange rate has never been as low as it is today, since 1980 and the establishment of the interbank currency market. While this situation may benefit some, such as exporters, for example, for the majority of Malagasy people, the immediate effect is inflation. And that's why we reached a very high inflation rate of 12%," continues David Rakoto. However, the governor of the Central Bank of Madagascar, Aivo Andrianarivelo, is keen to put the situation into perspective: "There is always what is called the psychological impact of a rate. And the psychological impact on the population is the variation of the euro, more than the dollar. At the Central Bank, we only manage the dollar/ariary parity. However, the depreciation of the ariary against the dollar is minimal: we should not worry about this because it remains stable.¬ª In the country, almost 60% of the trading volume is made in dollars, compared to 40% in euros. While the situation is far from dramatic in the eyes of the governor, the continued depreciation of the dollar on the international market, as is the current trend, could worsen the situation for Madagascar in the coming months. author: archyde
title: Warning Signs of Arthritis That Should Not be Neglected: Expert Advice
text:
2023-12-28 17:57:38
This Wednesday, December 27, 2023, several doctors are warning the population about these warning signs of arthritis that should not be neglected, in the columns of Huffpost.
While osteoarthritis is the most common form of arthritis, there are several forms such as gout, rheumatoid arthritis and lupus. So many joint inflammations which are sometimes the subject of warning signs which should not be neglected. ‚ÄúIn general, people experience greater pain when walking on slopes, uneven surfaces, and climbing stairs. Even clothing, such as socks and shoes, can be painful‚Äùexplains Dr. Mengnai Li, board-certified orthopedic surgeon and associate professor at Yale University School of Medicine.
Feeling joint pain as soon as you wake up is one of the elements likely to be associated with a form of arthritis or osteoarthritis. ‚ÄúAn early sign of arthritis is pain when waking up and getting up in the morning after sleeping for hours,‚Äù details the surgeon in the columns of
Huffpost. Morning pain in the joints is not the only sign of osteoarthritis that should not be taken lightly, at the risk of seeing this inflammation worsen over time.
The rest after this ad
Several types of arthritis pain
Still according to the comments collected by our colleagues, the fact of see your joints swell can also be an early sign of arthritis. This symptom may be the consequence of an accumulation of synovial fluid, the primary function of which is to lubricate and soften the joints. ‚ÄúWhen osteoarthritis occurs, there is an increase in the volume of synovial fluid production and associated inflammation, which causes pain and swelling.‚Äù,illustre Mengnai Li.
Read more: Manchester United officially announces the signing of Dutchman Fijorst until the end of the season
Another warning sign of potential arthritis, feel stiffness in your jointsa symptom that should be monitored all the more if it presents itself upon waking up. ‚ÄúMany of my patients with knee osteoarthritis experience stiffness after getting up from a rest period or after sitting in a chair for a period of time‚Äùexplains Pamela Mehta, orthopedic surgeon at Resilience Orthopedics.
The rest after this ad
Specialists draw attention to the fact that some warning signs of arthritis can take a more discreet form since they are not associated with any pain. According to Mengnai Li, the fact of Experiencing cracking or grinding noises in your joints may be an early sign of arthritis. These are all elements that should not be taken lightly at the risk of becoming subject, over time, to more painful inflammations in the joints. If there are warning signs of arthritis, you should therefore inform your doctor.
A journalist passionate about social issues and current affairs, Hugo puts his pen at the service of information. Interested in all themes, from the impact of artificial intelligence on‚Ä¶
1703804921
#warning #signs #arthritis #neglected

author: Sakchi Khandelwal
title: Sustainable Fashion: The Upcycling Revolution and Regenerative Practices
text:
In the heart of a world increasingly aware of its ecological footprint, the fashion industry, with its $1.7 trillion valuation, faces a pivotal moment of transformation. Amidst the sprawling expanse of textile waste, amounting to over 11 million tons annually, a beacon of hope shines through the efforts of individuals and organizations dedicated to combating the fast fashion paradigm. Today, we dive into the story of Joslyn West, a Bay Area clothing designer, whose commitment to upcycling vintage linens, Pendleton wool blankets, and cashmere sweaters into bespoke garments heralds a new dawn for sustainable fashion.
The Upcycling Renaissance
At the core of the sustainable fashion movement is the practice of upcycling, a process that breathes new life into pre-loved materials, transforming them into items of higher quality and environmental value. West's initiative stands as a stark contrast to the fast fashion industry's model of mass-producing inexpensive, disposable clothing, which often finds its way to landfills after minimal use. Her designs not only captivate environmentally conscious consumers but also highlight the importance of durability and quality in clothing. Her work, particularly appealing to millennials and Gen Z, underscores a growing demand for fashion that respects both the planet and its inhabitants.
From Waste to Wardrobe: The Story of Frame
In the fight against textile waste, the charity Frame emerges as a protagonist, illustrating the profound impact of upcycling and reselling donated garments. Through its innovative approach, Frame has not only seen an increase in profits but has also made significant strides in reducing the environmental footprint of the fashion industry. This success story serves as a compelling example of how sustainable fashion practices, such as shopping at charity shops and promoting second-hand clothing, can lead to a win-win situation for both the environment and the economy.
Regenerative Fashion: Sewing Seeds of Change
The narrative of sustainable fashion extends beyond upcycling, embracing the concept of regenerative fashion. This approach advocates for practices like regenerative agriculture, which aims to restore health to the earth, enhancing its biodiversity and mitigating land degradation. Brands like Patagonia, Eileen Fisher, and Stella McCartney, along with movements such as Fibreshed and companies like Seed 2 Shirt, are at the forefront of implementing regenerative practices. Their efforts signify a crucial shift towards a fashion industry that not only minimizes harm but actively contributes to the planet's well-being.
In conclusion, the journey towards a sustainable fashion industry is multi-faceted, involving the collective action of designers like Joslyn West, charities like Frame, and leading fashion brands. Each entity plays a vital role in weaving the fabric of a future where fashion and environmental stewardship coexist harmoniously. As we move forward, the importance of supporting sustainable, durable, and high-quality fashion becomes ever more apparent, promising a greener, more vibrant world for generations to come.
